name: RunPowerShellOnTargetMachines
description: Run PowerShell on Target Machines.  Executes PowerShell commands remotely on machine(s).
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machine Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Machine Group for deploying application.​

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Deploy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally provide a comma separated list of machines to deploy the application to. It defaults to all the machines in the Machine Group. For example, BudgetIT-Web01, BudgetIT-Web02.

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: PowerShell Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell script on the target machines or on a UNC path. For example, C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\Website.ps1

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
inputs.label: Script Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the PowerShell script.  Either ordinal parameters or named parameters. For example, -testParam test

inputs.name: InitializationScriptPath
inputs.label: Initialization Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally provide location of the PowerShell initialization script (data script for DSC) on the target machines or on a UNC path. For example, C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\WebsiteConfiguration.ps1

inputs.name: RunPowershellInParallel
inputs.label: Run Powershell Parallely
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will run powershell parellely on the machines.
